Detailed Description

Sample spherically or partially around a sphere.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

mr::sphereSampler::sphereSampler (  const miVector &  Nin,
const miScalar  spherePercent = 1.0f
)  [inline]
 

Constructor. Nin is the direction to sample around. spherePercent is percentage of sphere to cover. If sphere percent is 1, Nin is irrelevant. This call is to be used when sampling adaptively (ie. the number of samples to be taken are not known or may vary, or you may exit the loop early).

mr::sphereSampler::sphereSampler (  const miVector &  Nin,
const miUint &  numSamples,
const miScalar  spherePercent = 1.0f
)  [inline]
 

Constructor. Nin is the direction to sample around. spherePercent is percentage of sphere to cover. If sphere percent is 1, Nin is irrelevant. numSamples is the number of samples to take. It HAS to be miUint&

Destructor.

Get one sample using a uniform distribution or return false.

void mr::sphereSampler::uniformDistribution (   )  [inline, protected]
 

const miScalar mr::sphereSampler::weight (   )  [inline]
 

This returns a weight (dot product) of the sample with respect to the original Nin vector.
